result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyquanda J Mayfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Continue in cognitive thinking counseling. Pay ZCI fees. Restitution is held open. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Defendant Tyquanda J Mayfield in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue

Rights Given
P- NC
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1 & count 2 as amended in 15CF871 & count 1 in 15CM1511.

15CF871
Count 1- Withheld sentence, 1 year probation

Count 2- Withheld sentence, 1 year probation

15CM1511
Count 1- Withheld sentence, 1 year probation

Conditions: 
Continue in cognitive thinking counseling
Maintain employment + continue in school 
20 hours of community service
Pay the balance of ZCI fees
Provide a DNA Sample + pay surcharge on count 1 in 15CF871 only
Waive court costs in both files
Restitution is held open
Eligible for expungement if successfully completes probation
